name: Alfa Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Alfa this June (Our 2nd year there, and our 3rd year in Parga) and we will be back at the Alfa for June 2014.
reviews.title: Just Love This Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been travelling to Greece for 29 years and had never returned to the same place twice until I visited Parga. I enjoyed all my trips to Greece, but there is something about Parga that just captivates you the very first time you see the town, and you have to keep returning.........
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in lovely Parga.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our first trip to Parga we discovered the Senses Restaurant located at the Alfa Hotel and it became our favorite place to eat, authentic Greek food with an upscale twist in a beautiful setting.
reviews.title: sylvia/derek october 2013

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, it just made sense to stay at the Alfa for our future visits! This hotel has a great large pool, it is super-clean with beautiful gardens, a cozy bar and sitting area and really nice rooms. The Dimakos family who own and run this hotel are just wonderful, they are so dedicated, hard-working and extremely helpful, truly nice people.
reviews.title: Good Greek Hotel

reviews.text: I love the location of this hotel, just on the outskirts of town and a really short walk to beaches and everything else. There is a small grocery store right across the street from Alfa, run by a British lady and her Greek husband, they are very nice, friendly people who remembered us when we returned for our 2nd year.
reviews.title: FEMALE SOLO MATURE TRAVELLER

reviews.text: I am always a little sceptical of anything that receives rave reviews by the bucket load but I am delighted that my scepticism is totally unjustified with regards to the Hotel Alfa.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great restaurant, lovely location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From a late arrival on our first night (Sunday) when we were welcomed and settled into our immaculately clean rooms and then throughout the whole two weeks every single person at the Alfa made us feel welcome and could not do enough for us.
reviews.title: Would recommend to anyone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: Lovely, just far enough out of town to feel like a tranquil idyll and close enough to wander into town for lunch or dinner if you wish or to go the beach or get a water taxi elsewhere or jump on the boat to Corfu or pretty much whatever you want....
reviews.title: A REAL GEM

reviews.text: Reception: Nice open light area close enough to the pool so that the children could hang out whilst attached to the wireless internet service, still be in sight but also be out of everyone's way.....
reviews.title: Second visit with family, great again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms: Clean! In fact, the whole hotel is incredibly clean. I stay in a lot of 4 and 5 star hotels for work and I can't remember the last time I came across one where the rooms or the public areas were so meticulously cleaned. Comfortable beds, good aircon for the warmer days, fridge, safe, plenty of space, nice little balcony to sit on.
reviews.title: Wow Wow Wow!!!!!

reviews.text: We spent two weeks at the Alfa at the beginning of June and have to say it was the best holiday we have had, the family who run the hotel and all the staff there are warm, friendly and welcoming, the whole atmosphere at the hotel is relaxed and the other guests were all really friendly, the room we had was beautiful and the breakfast was amazing. We loved it and can't wait until we can go again.
reviews.title: Simply the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've never repeated a holiday but this was one we had to! Had a lovely week there in May 2010 and the same again this May. The hotel is small and the family / owners are so friendly and helpful. The breakfast is varied and substantial and taken in very pleasant surroundings. The pool area is very pretty and the lunchtime snacks are varied and reasonably priced. The small bar area provided a friendly atmosphere for a nightcap! The bedroom and bathroom were comfortable and spotless. Clean towels every day and a very efficient maid service. 3 good restaurants on the doorstep and only a 5 min walk to the centre of Parga. This holiday ticked all the boxes!
reviews.title: As good as last year!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from another stay at the Alfa and everything is just as good, shame we were only there for a week. The one new addition is Lisa who greets you with a big smile every morning at breakfast.
reviews.title: Nothing Changes - Just as Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nothing seems to change at the Alfa - even the prices in the bar & the Five Senses restaurant are the same as last year.
reviews.title: great Hotel would recommend without hesitation.

reviews.text: Speaking to Lazaros (owner) he said he only had one room empty for two nights right up to the end of the season, that tells you how good the Alfa is.
reviews.title: Attractive small friendly run hotel with great restaurant

reviews.text: We have just returned from a stay at the Alfa, our second visit to Parga. This hotel is owned and run by the Dimakos family, who are such helpful, hard-working, nice people, they will make your stay perfect. The pool is fairly large and very well kept, the rooms are nicely furnished and everywhere in this hotel is immaculately clean. The hotel restaurant, The Five Senses, in my opinion, is the best in Parga, and we have tried lots of places, but we keep coming back! The Alfa has a great location, just on the edge of town, a few minutes walk and you are in the breathtakingly beautiful town of Parga. For me, this place has everything, and not surprisingly, they have so many guests who return year after year, some of them more than once a year. Great place, I highly recommend it.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Family-Run Hotel

reviews.text: We have just returned from Parga this being our 18th visit. We have always said there is too much of the world to see without going back to the same place. How wrong can one be! This is a wonderful hotel, with absolutely lovely people who run it. Nothing is too much trouble for them. From the minute you step over their threshold to the moment you come away. The hotel is spotlessly clean. The towels and bedding are changed regularly. There is a small fridge in your room. A small charge is made for a safety deposit box. The air conditioning in each room is free. The breakfasts are lovely, with lots of choice, including bacon, different types of cooked eggs, sausage, tomatoes, Greek yoghurt, honey, fresh fruit, cereals, toast, tea, coffee, fruit juice etc. Try the Five Senses Restaurant, is is a beautiful restaurant, which is part of the hotel. The prices are the same as in the town. The food is lovely and presented really well. All in all a lovely hotel to spend your holiday in. Parga is Greece's hidden secret, and The Alfa Hotel is a hidden gem, well worth a visit. Looking forward to next year, a holiday which is already booked - roll on next year!
reviews.title: One of the best hotels in Parga

reviews.text: This is my first ever review as I have never felt the need to express my likes and dislikes as an holiday can quite easily have both depending on taste and expectations.
reviews.title: Friendly, respectful and excellent value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have travelled well over the years and visited some luxury hotels including 5* which would take some beating.
reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a family run hotel with mother, father and son, you instantly feel the warmth from the greeting from the moment you arrive and continue to be treated by there warmth, politeness and attention to detail during all of your stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: What a Gem!

reviews.text: Just returned from holiday Sept 2011, spent a week in this great family run little hotel. Very, very clean and very friendly. The resturant the 5 Senses is great, the service, food and wine are first class. 10 min walk to the town and harbour, torch is needed. Parga Town is very pretty the castle all lit up at night is wonderful, sitting on a rooftop bar watching the world go by.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel

reviews.text: We stayed, along with friends, at the Alfa for a second year and once again had a very enjoyable stay in this excellent, family run hotel. The rooms have a/c , TV, + ( at currently 5 euro p/w each ) fridge and safety deposit box. Rooms are comfortable, spotlessly clean, and very unusually for Greece has linen changed daily. We have always found the rooms quiet There is a comprehensive breakfast, normally with bacon, scrambled or fired egg, tomato / baked beans, breads, cheese, ham, cereals, and wonderful greek yoghurt and of course honey. The breakfast is also popular with non-residents ( who are currently charged 6 euro ). The hotel has a very attractive pool area with a small childrens pool, lots of sun beds and some shade - again it is open to non-residents, who can also enjoy the very good quality snack menu available between 12 and 4. The hotel is deservedly popular and has high repeat bookings, often made a year in advance.
reviews.title: a lovely hotel

reviews.text: We stayed for 2 weeks the end of August to September, we found the Alpha to be everything we wanted! all aspects of the hotel were 1st class! We would have no problem in going back, the rooms were great, the air-con was a absolute joy with the temperature in the 90's everyday and indeed for some days into the 100's.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.text: All the staff were extreemley friendly, and as it is a family run hotel nothing was to much trouble for us. The pool area is great and with a smaller one for children, it was very safe.
reviews.title: We spent wonderful days in the sun by the pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the five sense's restaraunt a couple of times & the food was marvellous, thanks to Dimitri and his staff!
reviews.title: Friendly Hotel

description: The Alfa is a warm and inviting family run hotel, taking pride in offering its guests a relaxing and charming 'home from home' in Parga with many guests returning on a regular basis. Our long experience helps us ensure your stay is as comfortable and enjoyable as possible whether it's for a single night or longer.
